text: Mannophryne is a group of frogs that live in Venezuela and in Trinidad and Tobago. People call them fingered poison frogs in English. Scientists made this group in 1992. Before that, they had put the frogs in the same group as Colostethus trinitatis. All species have a dark throat collar. ==Species== Mannophryne has 20 species of frog in it, many of which used to be in the genus Colostethus: ==References== Category:Frogs of South America
title: Mannophryne
